to ask the resource =

details "OPTIONS" as 
"The O=
PTIONS method represents a request for information about the
communication =
options available on the request/response chain
identified by the Request-U=
RI. This method allows the client to
determine the options and/or requireme=
nts associated with a resource,
or the capabilities of a server, without im=
plying a resource action or
initiating a resource retrieval."

http://www.w=
3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec9.html#sec9.2
